label: 三大会
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: (alt. san’e 三会) the three great annual Buddhist assemblies held either in the “southern capital” (Nara) or in the greater palace precincts in the capital during Heian times and beyond. They included Kôfukuji’s Yuimae, Yakushiji’s Saishôe, and the Misaie held at the palace.
